sen.j: 藤田 信吉（ふじた のぶよし、永禄2年（1559年） - 元和 (日本)2年7月14日 (旧暦)（1616年8月26日））は、戦国時代 (日本)から江戸時代前期にかけての武将。
sen.e: Nobuyoshi FUJITA (1559-August, 26, 1616) was a busho (Japanese military commander) from the Sengoku period (period of warring state) to the first half of the Edo period.
Nobuyoshi FUJITA (1559-August, 26, 1616) was a busho (Japanese military commander) from the Sengoku period (period of warring states) to the first half of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: Nobuyoshi FUJITA (1559 - August, 26, 1616) was a military commander from the period of warring states to the first half of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 山内上杉家の家臣・藤田康邦の次男（異説あり）。
sen.e: He was a vassal of the Yamanouchi-Uesugi family and was the second son of Yasukuni FUJITA (there are also different theories).
He was a vassal of the Yamanouchi-Uesugi family and was the second son of Yasukuni FUJITA (there are also different theories).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He was a vassal of the Yamanouchi-Uesugi family and was the second son of Yasukuni FUJITA, although there are also different theories.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 別名、重信。
sen.e: He had another name, Shigenobu.
He had another name--Shigenobu.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: He had an alias--Shigenobu.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

tit.j: 武田氏・上杉氏家臣として
tit.e: As a vassal of the Uesugi clan and the Takeda clan
As a vassal of the Uesugi clan and the Takeda clan
As a vassal of the Uesugi clan and a vassal of the Takeda clan
tit.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 信吉が生まれた頃、山内上杉氏はすでに滅んでいた。
sen.e: The Yamanouchi-Uesugi clan had been already downfallen before Nobuyoshi was born.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Yamanouchi-Uesugi clan had been already suffered their downfall before Nobuyoshi was born.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: The Yamanouchi-Uesugi clan had been already suffered their downfall before Nobuyoshi was born.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 藤田氏も後北条氏の一族北条氏邦に家督を奪われていたため、信吉は北条氏を離反し、武田勝頼の家臣として仕えた。
sen.e: Because Ujikuni HOJO, a family member of the Gohojo clan deprived the head of the Fujita clan, Nobuyoshi rebelled against the Hojo clan, and served as a vassal of Katsuyori TAKEDA.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because Ujikuni HOJO, a family member of the Gohojo clan deprived the head of the Fujita clan, Nobuyoshi rebelled against the Hojo clan, and served as a vassal of Katsuyori TAKEDA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Because Ujikuni HOJO, a family member of the Gohojo clan, deprived the property of the Fujita clan, Nobuyoshi broke away from the Hojo clan and served as a vassal of Katsuyori TAKEDA.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: はじめ用土・小野姓を称していたが、天正7年（1579年）に勝頼から藤田姓と能登国守、そして上野国沼田に5700貫の所領を拝領した。
sen.e: At first, he referred himself as 用土 or ONO, and he was granted FUJITA as a family name, the position of Noto no kuni no kami (Governor of Noto Province), and the territory of 5700 Kan in Numata, Kozuke Province by Katsuyori in 1579.
sen.cmt: 用土→読み方不明のため原文のままとしています。
sen.e: At first, he referred himself as 用土 or ONO, and he was granted FUJITA as a family name, the position of Noto no kuni no kami (Governor of Noto Province), and the territory of 5700 Kan in Numata, Kozuke Province by Katsuyori in 1579.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: At first, he referred himself as YODO or ONO, and he was granted FUJITA as a family name, the position of Noto no kuni no kami (Governor of Noto Province), and the territory of 5700 Kan of rice (1 kan is 3.75 kg) in Numata, Kozuke Province by Katsuyori in 1579.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 天正10年（1582年）、武田氏が織田信長によって滅ぼされると、上杉景勝のもとに逃れて、その家臣となった。
sen.e: After the Takeda clan was defeated by Nobunaga ODA in 1582, he was sheltered under Kagekatsu UESUGI, and became UESUGI's vassal.
After the Takeda clan was defeated by Nobunaga ODA in 1582, he was sheltered under Kagekatsu UESUGI, and became UESUGI's vassal.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: After the Takeda clan was defeated by Nobunaga ODA in 1582, he fled to Kagekatsu UESUGI and became Uesugi's vassal.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: そして景勝に従って新発田重家討伐、佐渡国の本間氏討伐、小田原征伐に従軍して功を立てた。
sen.e: Thereafter, he followed Kagekatsu and joined his army, contributing to conquests of Shigeie SHIBATA, the Honma clan in Sado Province, and Odawara.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Thereafter, he followed Kagekatsu and joined his army, contributing to conquests of Shigeie SHIBATA, the Honma clan in Sado Province, and Odawara.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Thereafter, he followed Kagekatsu and joined his army, contributing to the conquest of Shigeie SHIBATA, the Honma clan in Sado Province, and Odawara.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 慶長3年（1598年）に上杉氏が会津に移封されると、景勝から大森に1万5000石の所領を与えられた。
sen.e: When the Uesugi clan was transferred to Aizu in 1598, he was granted the territory of fifteen thousands Goku crop yields in Omori by Kagekatsu.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When the Uesugi clan was transferred to Aizu in 1598, he was granted territory of a crop yielf of fifteen thousand Goku in Omori by Kagekatsu.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: When the Uesugi clan was transferred to Aizu in 1598, he was granted territory of 15,000 koku in Omori by Kagekatsu.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

tit.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 慶長5年（1600年）、信吉は景勝の代理で新年の祝賀のために上洛する。
sen.e: In 1600, Nobuyoshi went up to Kyoto for New year's greetings on behalf of Kagekatsu.
In 1600, Nobuyoshi went up to Kyoto for New Year's greetings on behalf of Kagekatsu.
sen.cmt: case
sen.e: In 1600, Nobuyoshi went up to Kyoto for the New Year's greetings on behalf of Kagekatsu.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: この際徳川家康は信吉に対し銀子、青江直次の刀等を送るなどして好意的に接している。
sen.e: Ieyasu TOKUGAWA treated Nobuyoshi favorably, and gave him gifts such as Intsu (silver currency), a sword of Naotsugu AOE.
Ieyasu TOKUGAWA treated Nobuyoshi favorably, and gave him gifts such as Intsu (silver currency) and the sword of Naotsugu AOE.
sen.cmt: punctuation; wording
sen.e: Ieyasu TOKUGAWA treated Nobuyoshi favorably, giving him gifts such as Intsu (silver currency) and the sword of Naotsugu AOE.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: そのため信吉は家康に大変好意を持ったといわれる。
sen.e: For this, Nobuyoshi had a favorable impression for Ieyasu.
For this, Nobuyoshi had a favorable impression of Ieyasu.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: For that reason, Nobuyoshi had a favorable impression of Ieyasu.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 景勝が家老の直江兼続と図って徳川家康に敵対する姿勢を見せ始めると、信吉は景勝に思いとどまるように諫言すると同時に、大坂に上坂して家康に「上杉氏に敵対の意思は無い」と懸命に両家の融和に努めた。
sen.e: When Kagekatsu began to show an attitude of opposing to Ieyasu TOKUGAWA with Kagekatsu's vassal, Kanetsugu NAOE, Nobuyoshi advised Kagekatsu to avoid a confliction against Ieyasu while he visited Osaka to inform Ieyasu `The Uesugi clan is not hostile to you', making efforts to integrate them.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kagekatsu began to show a confrontational attitude towards Ieyasu TOKUGAWA with Kagekatsu's vassal, Kanetsugu NAOE. Consequently Nobuyoshi advised Kagekatsu to avoid a conflict with Ieyasu, while he visited Osaka to inform Ieyasu `The Uesugi clan is not hostile to you', making efforts to integrate them.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: When Kagekatsu began to show a confrontational attitude towards Ieyasu TOKUGAWA with the chief retainer Kanetsugu NAOE, Nobuyoshi advised Kagekatsu to avoid a conflict with Ieyasu, and also visited Osaka to inform Ieyasu 'The Uesugi clan is not hostile to you,' making efforts to integrate them.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 兼続から圧力を受けて上杉氏から出奔を余儀なくされ、徳川秀忠のもとに難を逃れた。
sen.e: With Kanetsugu's pressure, Nobuyoshi was forced to leave the Uesugi clan, and escaped into Hidetada TOKUGAWA's place.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: With Kanetsugu's pressure, Nobuyoshi was forced to leave the Uesugi clan, and escaped to find refuge with Hidetada TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: Under the pressure from Kanetsugu, Nobuyoshi was forced to leave the Uesugi clan and escaped to find refuge with Hidetada TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: このとき、信吉が家康と秀忠に対して「上杉氏に謀反の疑いあり」と言上したことが、関ヶ原の戦いの契機となったともいわれる。
sen.e: It is said that the Battle of Sekigahara was caused by Nobuyoshi's report `The Uesugi clan may rebel against TOKUGAWA' to Ieyasu and Hidetada.
It is said that the Battle of Sekigahara was caused by Nobuyoshi's report `The Uesugi clan may rebel against TOKUGAWA' to Ieyasu and Hidetada.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: It is said that the Battle of Sekigahara was caused by Nobuyoshi's report 'The Uesugi clan may rebel against TOKUGAWA' to Ieyasu and Hidetada.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その後、信吉は大徳寺に入って剃髪し、源心と号した。
sen.e: Thereafter, Nobuyoshi entered Daitoku-ji Temple, and tonsured, referring himself as Genshin.
Thereafter, Nobuyoshi entered Daitoku-ji Temple, and tonsured, referring to himself as Genshin.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: Thereafter, Nobuyoshi entered Daitoku-ji Temple, took tonsure, and adopted the name of Genshin.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: そして関ヶ原後、下野国西方藩に1万5000石の所領を与えられた。
sen.e: After the Battle of Sekigahara, he was granted the territory of fifteen thousands Goku crop yields in the Nishikata Domain, Shimotsuke Province.
After the Battle of Sekigahara, he was granted territory of a crop yield of fifteen thousand Goku in the Nishikata Domain, Shimotsuke Province.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: After the Battle of Sekigahara, he was granted territory of a crop yield of fifteen thousand koku in the Nishikata Domain, Shimotsuke Province.
sen.cmt: kokuとしました。

sen.j: 慶長7年（1602年）、佐竹義宣 (右京大夫)が常陸国水戸藩から出羽国秋田藩へ減移封されたとき、水戸城を守備している。
sen.e: When Yoshinobu SATAKE (Ukyo no daibu (Master of the Western Capital Offices)) was transferred from the Mito Domain, Hitachi Province to a smaller domain, the Akita Domain, Dewa Province in 1602, he defended Mito Castle.

When Yoshinobu SATAKE (Ukyo no daibu [Master of the Western Capital Offices]) was transferred from the Mito Domain, Hitachi Province to a smaller domain, the Akita Domain, Dewa Province in 1602, he defended Mito Castle.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: When Yoshinobu SATAKE, the Master of the Western Capital Offices, was transferred from the Mito Domain, Hitachi Province to a smaller domain, the Akita Domain, Dewa Province in 1602, he defended Mito-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 大坂の役にも従軍したが、慶長20年（1615年）の夏の陣後、改易された。
sen.e: He joined the Osaka no Eki (The Siege of Osaka), but he was punished by being deprived of his fief after the battle in summer of 1615.
He joined the Osaka no Eki (The Siege of Osaka), but he was punished by being deprived of his fief after the battle in the summer of 1615.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: He joined the the Siege of Osaka, but he was punished by being deprived of his fief after the Summer Siege of 1615.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 理由は榊原康勝軍の軍監を務めていたときの失態、戦功に対する不満からの失言など諸々の理由を挙げられている。
sen.e: Various reasons; a failure he committed when he worked as an Assistant Deputy General of Yasukatsu SAKAKIBARA's force, his infelicity from dissatisfactory for his achievement in the battle, are considered for this.

The various reasons considered for this include his failure as an Assistant Deputy General of Yasukatsu SAKAKIBARA's force, his insolent manner from his dissatisfaction with his achievement in battle.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: The various reasons considered for this include his failure as an army superintendent of Yasukatsu SAKAKIBARA's force and his insolent manner from his dissatisfaction with his achievement in battle.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 元和2年（1616年）7月14日、58歳で死去。
sen.e: On July 14, 1616, he passed away at the age of 58.
On July 14, 1616, he passed away at the age of 58.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: On August 26, 1616, he passed away at the age of 58.
sen.cmt: 元和2年7月14日を西暦に直しました。

sen.j: 死因は病死説もあるが、近年では自殺説が有力となっている。
sen.e: He was said to be died of disease, but recently, suicide theory has been widely accepted.
He was said to die of disease, but recently, a theory claiming suicide has been widely accepted.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: He was said to die of disease, but recently, a theory claiming that he died of suicide has been widely accepted.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 墓所は栃木県上都賀郡西方町の実相寺。
sen.e: His tomb is in Jisso-ji Temple in Nishikata-machi, Kamitsuga-gun, Tochigi Prefecture.
His tomb is in Jisso-ji Temple in Nishikata-machi, Kamitsuga-gun, Tochigi Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His tomb is in Jisso-ji Temple in Nishikata-machi, Kamitsuga-gun, Tochigi Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

tit.e: Assessment of him in later ages
tit.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 信吉は関ヶ原の戦いの原因を作り出した武将として有名で、保身のために上杉氏から徳川氏に鞍替えしたと言われている。
sen.e: Nobuyoshi is well known as a busho who caused the Battle of Sekigahara, and was said to switch from the Uesugi clan to the Tokugawa clan to save himself.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Nobuyoshi is well known as a busho who caused the Battle of Sekigahara, and was said to switch from the Uesugi clan to the Tokugawa clan to save himself.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Nobuyoshi is well known as a military commander who made the cause of the Battle of Sekigahara, and was said to have switched from the Uesugi clan to the Tokugawa clan to save himself.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、信吉は信吉なりに上杉氏を救おうと大坂に上坂して景勝のことを弁護するなど、懸命に奔走している。
sen.e: However, Nobuyoshi desperately attempted to save the Uesugi clan, going up to Osaka to plead for saving Kagekatsu.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, Nobuyoshi desperately attempted to save the Uesugi clan by travelling to Osaka to pleading for the life of Kagekatsu.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: However, Nobuyoshi desperately attempted to save the Uesugi clan by travelling to Osaka for pleading for the life of Kagekatsu.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: だが、上杉氏には上杉謙信以来の軍事的な自負があり、和平論者の信吉は結果的に孤立を余儀なくされてしまったのである。
sen.e: The Uesugi clan had been proud of their military actions since Kenshin UESUGI appeared, and Nobuyoshi who advocated peace was forced to be isolated as a result.
The Uesugi clan had been proud of their military actions since Kenshin UESUGI appeared, and Nobuyoshi who advocated peace was forced into isolation as a result.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: The Uesugi clan had been proud of their military actions since the appearance of Kenshin UESUGI, and Nobuyoshi who advocated peace was forced into isolation as a result.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。
